comment.author: 38896199@N06
comment._content: NLI have you ever had a family member contact you about a photograph on Flickr yet, I mean there is every chance that there are direct descendants of this family still in the area or nearby. They may never have seen such images, or could have seen them all, who knows!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/int0lerant] We have! Some relatives and some neighbours have been spotted. And some completely unidentified people have been named, e.g. this contact's grandfather...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Another very interesting shot NLI with a wealth of detail to mull over!  The dresses are seemingly all from the one seamstress with a (to me) distinctly nationalist style to them.  Some of the girls appear to have had a bit of a bad hair day although in those days they did not have the benefit of electric hairdryers and hairspray!  The Daddy is a very handsome looking man - reminds me of a former colleague of the same name from that part of Wexford.

comment.author: 55597723@N02
comment._content: Lovely Family. Nicely taken. If I were young back then and lived next door to them- I might have asked one of the daughters for a date. Very Nice Photo.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/55597723@N02] You would have had plenty to choose from! Poor Mr Kehoe must have worried about paying for five girls' weddings...

comment.author: 80302623@N05
comment._content: Great to see a shot like this, the dress is very much in keeping with the Celtic Revivalist style which was popular with a certain section of society at the time and can be tied into organisations going back to Maud Gonne's Inghidigne na hEireann . Unfortunately, not long after this it became absorbed into Irish dancing costume, having started out as a form of Nationalist dress etc.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/80302623@N05] Thank you. Glad you like it! If you're interested in Inghinidhe na hÉireann, you might like this handbill from our other Flickr stream...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
